inclusion.criterion: platelet count <50 x10^9/L at the time of starting antithrombotic prophylaxis or diagnosis of arterial or venous thromboembolism objectively proven
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: diagnosis of arterial thrombosis include acute coronary syndrome, ischemic stroke (including major and minor stroke), peripheral arterial thrombosis, retinal arterial thrombosis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: diagnosis of venous thrombosis include thrombosis of deep veins of the limbs and the abdomen, superficial veins of limbs, cerebral and splanchnic veins, retinal vein, and pulmonary embolism. Splanchnic venous thrombosis include occlusion of hepatic, portal, mesenteric, and splenic veins
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: transient ischemic attack without CT and/or NMR signs
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: superficial vein thrombosis without Doppler ultrasound examination showing evidence of thrombosis
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: antithrombotic prophylaxis only local for central venous lines (i.e. CVC flushing with heparin)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: occlusion of the central venous catheter
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: platelet count >50 x10^9/L at time of thrombosis but subsequent thrombocytopenia <50 x10^9/L while receiving antithrombotic treatment
inclusion.label: met
